==Japanese==

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|尊皇}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|そん|おう|k2=のう|yomi=o}}
Originally from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=そんのう}} compound {{m|ltc|尊王|tr=*t͡zuən *hiuɑng||revere the king}}, probably from the phrase {{m|ltc|尊王攘夷|tr=*t͡zuən *hiuɑng *njaŋ *i||revere the king, expel the barbarians}}, appearing in Chinese literature beginning in the [[w:Warring States period|Warring States period]], some time between 475 BC and 221 BC.

In Japanese, {{lang|ja|尊王}} and {{ja-l|尊皇}} are both read as ''sonnō'' and have mostly the same meaning (“revere the ruler”). The {{ja-l|尊皇}} spelling might be preferred in Japanese contexts, as Japan has historically had an [[emperor]] ({{ja-l|皇}}) instead of a [[king]] ({{ja-l|王}}).

{{ja-renjō|ō|nō|王|sort=そんのう}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|acc=0|y=o|acc_ref=DJR|そんのう}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|そんのう|hhira=そんわう}}

# [[reverence]] for the [[emperor]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-l|尊王論|そんのうろん|sonnōron}}: [[royalism]], a belief in the [[supremacy]] of the [[monarchy]]
* {{ja-l|尊王攘夷|そんのうじょうい|sonnō jōi}}: [[revere]] the [[emperor]], [[kick out]] the [[barbarian]]s {{qualifier|[[nationalist]] [[slogan]]}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|そん|おう|yomi=o}}
The older reading for this term, without [[Appendix:Japanese_glossary#renjō|renjō]] ({{m|ja|連声}}, “[[sandhi]]”).<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=o|そんおう}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|そんおう|hhira=そんわう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=そんおう|rare|archaic}} [[reverence]] for the [[emperor]]
